  • dust: 3,500 Dai
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Risk Parameter Definitions Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Risk Parameter Definitions Core The Native Vault Engine risk parameters are defined in the subdocuments herein.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Liquidation Ratio Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Liquidation Ratio Core

The Liquidation Ratio parameter limits the maximum amount of Dai debt that a vault user can draw from their vault given the value of their collateral locked in that vault. In practice, it expresses the minimum collateral in percentage terms that can support a given Dai debt. If the ratio of a Vault user's collateral to their debt drops below this value, their vault can be liquidated. Each vault type has its own Liquidation Ratio. The Liquidation Ratio for each vault type is expressed as a percentage value of the collateral that must be present in the vault to support its debt.

Changes to the Liquidation Ratio are subject to the Operational Weekly Cycle, requiring a Governance Poll followed by an Executive Vote.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Limit Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Limit Core

The Debt Ceiling Limit is numerically provided and acts as an upper limit. Core GovOps, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, can propose changes within this limit.

Debt Ceiling Limit = Unlimited is defined as large enough to avoid being reached in the near future.

The DC-IAM methodology contained in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module (DC-IAM) acts as a risk mitigation tool. It limits the rate at which exposure can increase in a short period of time in the event of an unexpected emergency.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Stability Fee Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Stability Fee Core

The Stability Fee parameter is an annual percentage fee charged on the Dai generated on Vaults. It is expressed as an annual percentage yield but it is charged on a per-block basis in Dai. The Dai from this fee is minted, added to the Dai debt for the vault, and then transferred into the Surplus Buffer which is under the control of Sky Governance. Each vault type has its own Stability Fee that can be adjusted independently.

The Stability Fees can be modified through either Executive Votes or the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module. See A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module.

The Stability Fees must be gradually increased over time to incentivize users to migrate to SparkLend and other borrowing platforms offered by Prime Agents.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module (DC-IAM) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module (DC-IAM) Core The DC-IAM allows any user to adjust the Debt Ceiling of a supported vault type according to the rules defined in the DC-IAM smart contract logic and parameters set by the Stability Facilitators. The DC-IAM holds three parameters that can be set by Sky Governance for each vault type, (i) Maximum Debt Ceiling (line), (ii) Target Available Debt (gap), and (iii) Ceiling Increase Cooldown (ttl).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) Core

The line parameter refers to the maximum value for the Debt Ceiling that the DC-IAM will allow in the given vault type. When using the DC-IAM to manage the Debt Ceiling of a vault type, the line parameter essentially replaces the Debt Ceiling parameter for that vault type. Rather than Sky Governance setting the Debt Ceiling directly, they will need to set the Maximum Debt Ceiling (line) in the DC-IAM. The line parameter is defined in Dai.

The Maximum Debt Ceiling is defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Ceiling Limit and is currently unlimited.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Target Available Debt (gap) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Target Available Debt (gap) Core The gap parameter controls how much of a gap the DC-IAM aims to maintain between the current debt usage and the Debt Ceiling of the vault type. The higher this value, the more risk there is from large collateral drops in very short amounts of time. The smaller this value, the more vault use is negatively affected. The gap parameter is defined in Dai.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Ceiling Increase Cooldown (ttl) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Ceiling Increase Cooldown (ttl) Core The Ceiling Increase Cooldown (ttl) parameter controls how frequently the Debt Ceiling can be increased by the DC-IAM. If a user attempts to use the DC-IAM to increase the Debt Ceiling of a vault type before this time expires, the transaction will fail to execute and the Debt Ceiling will remain unchanged. The ttl parameter in combination with the gap parameter enforces a maximum rate at which debt usage can increase over time using a given vault type. These parameters should be set such that the maximum increase over time can accommodate all reasonable usage of the vault type in question. The ttl parameter is defined in seconds.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Parameters Core A clear justification and analysis must be provided to validate any proposed changes to the parameters specified in this document. Before these changes are added to an Executive Vote, Core GovOps, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, must obtain approval through a Governance Poll. However, in an emergency, Core GovOps, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, has the authority to bypass the Governance Poll and add the proposed parameters directly to an Executive Vote. The parameters contained herein must be regularly monitored and updated if needed.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (calc) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (calc) Core

The Auction Price Function is the mathematical function that determines how the collateral price changes over time during a collateral auction. Collateral auctions use a falling price auction, where the price starts high and decreases according to the function defined in this parameter.

The Exponential Stair Step function contains two key parameters, cut and step, defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (cut) and A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (step), respectively.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (cut) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (cut) Core The cut parameter controls the 'depth' of each step in the function. A smaller cut means a smoother line; a large one means more pronounced steps. The cut parameter is defined as a multiplicative factor. For example, 0.99 equated to a 1% price drop.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (step) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Function (step) Core The step parameter controls the length of time between price drops. A smaller step means a smoother line; a large one means more pronounced steps. The step parameter is defined in seconds.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Multiplier (buf) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Auction Price Multiplier (buf) Core The buf parameter is a multiplier that is applied to the starting price of a collateral auction. Each vault type has its own Auction Price Multiplier that can be adjusted by Sky Governance separately. This multiplier is intended to be greater than 1.0x because Liquidations 2.0 uses falling price auctions. This means that it is generally preferable for the auction price to begin above the market price and then fall to the correct value over some amount of time. The buf parameter is defined as a multiplicative factor.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Max Auction Drawdown (cusp) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Max Auction Drawdown (cusp) Core

The Max Auction Drawdown is the maximum percentage drop in collateral price during a collateral auction before the auction is reset. 'Collateral price' in this context refers to the collateral auction price rather than the collateral market price.

The Max Auction Drawdown parameter overlaps with the Max Auction Duration parameter in that an auction will need to be reset once either maximum is exceeded.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Max Auction Duration (tail) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Max Auction Duration (tail) Core

The Max Auction Duration parameter sets the maximum time that can elapse before an auction needs to reset for a particular vault type. Expressed in seconds, this parameter determines when an auction can no longer settle and must be reset.

The Max Auction Duration parameter overlaps with the Max Auction Drawdown parameter in that an auction will need to be reset once either maximum is exceeded.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Proportional Kick Incentive (chip) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Proportional Kick Incentive (chip) Core The Proportional Kick Incentive parameter represents a reward in Dai paid to the keepers that trigger collateral liquidation auctions in the Sky Protocol. The Proportional Kick Incentive is set as a percentage and represents a portion of Dai based on the debt of the vault that is being liquidated. The Dai is rewarded for each liquidation auction at the point the auction is triggered. Each vault type has its own Proportional Kick Incentive that may be adjusted separately by Sky Governance.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Flat Kick Incentive (tip) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Flat Kick Incentive (tip) Core The Flat Kick Incentive parameter represents a reward in Dai paid to the keepers that trigger collateral liquidation auctions in the Sky Protocol. The Flat Kick Incentive is a fixed amount of Dai that is rewarded for each liquidation auction at the point the auction is triggered. Each vault type has its own Flat Kick Incentive that may be adjusted separately by Sky Governance.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Liquidation Penalty (chop) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Liquidation Penalty (chop) Core The Liquidation Penalty parameter controls the fee vault owners must pay when their position is liquidated due to insufficient collateral. For a vault holder to receive any collateral back from the liquidations process, the debt and Liquidation Penalty must be covered by the collateral auction. Each vault type has its own Liquidation Penalty that can be adjusted by Sky Governance.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Local Liquidation Limit (hole) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Local Liquidation Limit (hole) Core The Local Liquidation Limit sets the maximum amount of Dai debt for which collateral auctions can be active at any one time within a particular vault type. When the total Dai value of auctions exceeds this maximum for a particular vault type, no more collateral can be auctioned using that vault type until others are completed. Each vault type has a separate Local Liquidation Limit.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Floor (dust) Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Debt Floor (dust) Core The Debt Floor parameter controls the minimum amount of Dai that can be minted using a specific vault type for an individual vault. If a user tries to mint Dai and the amount of Dai minted would not put the vault's amount of Dai minted above its Debt Floor, the transaction will fail and no DAi will be minted. Likewise, if a user attempts to pay back debt such that their debt will equal less than the Debt Floor and greater than zero, the transaction will fail and no Dai will be paid back. Each vault type has its own Debt Floor that can be adjusted by Sky Governance.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Collateral Offboarding Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Collateral Offboarding Core The processes for offboarding Native Vault Engine collateral are defined in the subdocuments herein.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Collateral Offboarding Process Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Collateral Offboarding Process Core The Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, must use the Operational Weekly Cycle to offboard Native Vault Engine collateral pursuant to A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Collateral Offboarding and its subdocuments.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding Low Usage Collateral Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding Low Usage Collateral Core To protect the Protocol from unnecessary complexity, the Stability Facilitators must offboard collateral types specified in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Vault Types if they fall below a total debt of 20 million.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding WBTC Collateral Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding WBTC Collateral Core WBTC-A, WBTC-B and WBTC-C are defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Vault Types only for the purpose of Stability Fee consistency. These are otherwise not considered Native Vault Engine collateral and should be offboarded according to A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding Other Collateral.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding Other Collateral Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Offboarding Other Collateral Core All other collateral types should be offboarded when the Stability Facilitators deem it appropriate and when new mechanisms are in place to take over the roles previously covered by the offboarded collateral.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Oracles Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Oracles Core

The Native Vault Engine collateral types of ETH, STETH, WBTC will specifically use the Chronicle v3 oracle solution, until at least January 1st 2026. The Native Vault Engine collateral types must be migrated to the new version of the Chronicle v3 oracle when it is feasible to do so.

Other oracle solutions, including diversified oracles, will only be considered until January 1st, 2026, and only if there are unresolvable security concerns with the Chronicle v3 oracles.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Updates Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Updates Core If not otherwise specified, Core GovOps, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, has the ability to modify any of the parameters defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Risk Parameter Definitions for any of the Vault Types in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Native Vault Engine - Vault Types. As a general rule, the modification of said parameters is pursuant to the Operational Weekly Cycle and can be effected directly via an Executive Vote, without requiring a Governance Poll. Exceptions to this general rule must be clearly stated in the relevant Atlas document.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module (SP-BEAM) enables designated, Governance-whitelisted operators to adjust the Stability Fees of supported vault types, the Dai Savings Rate (DSR), and the Sky Savings Rate (SSR). Adjustments are governed by the SP-BEAM smart contract logic and specific parameters set by Sky Governance. SP-BEAM holds four parameters that can be set for each vault type or savings rate: (i) min, (ii) max, (iii) step, and (iv) tau.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions Core The documents herein define the parameters of the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Min Definition Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Min Definition Core The min parameter defines the minimum value for rates in basis points that can be set using the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module. Each rate parameter added to the SP-BEAM has a specific min.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition Core The max parameter defines the maximum value for rates in basis points that can be set using the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module. Each rate parameter added to the SP-BEAM has a specific max.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition - Max Technical Upper Limit Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition - Max Technical Upper Limit Core Although the max parameter can be set higher, the SP-BEAM cannot be used to set a rate higher than 50% (5,000 basis points) due to technical limitations. Attempts to use the SP-BEAM in this manner will revert. To avoid confusion, max should not be set to a value higher than 50% (5,000 basis points).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Step Definition Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Step Definition Core The step parameter limits how much the rates can be increased or decreased in a single transaction in basis points, bound by the tau parameter. Each rate parameter added to the SP-BEAM has a specific step.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition Core

The tau parameter defines the minimum time interval, in seconds, that must elapse between consecutive uses or operations of the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module.

An SP-BEAM operation may adjust one or more parameters. Once an SP-BEAM operation is executed, the tau duration must expire before any subsequent SP-BEAM operation can be performed.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value Core The tau is currently set to 57,600 seconds (16 hours).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters for the Native Vaults are defined in the subdocuments herein. When new vaults are added to the protocol, they must also be added to the SP-BEAM. Unless specified otherwise within the relevant subdocument herein, the SP-BEAM parameters for any newly added Native Vault type shall default to match the parameters defined herein for the ETH-A vault type.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters - ETH-A Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters - ETH-A Parameters Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters for the ETH-A Vault are as follows:
  • max - 3,000 basis points,
  • min - 200 basis points,
  • step - 400 basis points,
  • tau - Globally defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters - ETH-B Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Native Vault Parameters - ETH-B Parameters Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters for the ETH-B Vault are as follows:
  • max - 3,000 basis points,
  • min - 200 basis points,
  • step - 400 basis points,
  • tau - Globally defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value.

A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Allocator Vault Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Allocator Vault Parameters Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters for the Allocator Vaults are defined in the subdocuments herein. When new Allocator Vaults are added, they must also be added to the SP-BEAM. Unless specified otherwise within the relevant subdocument herein, the SP-BEAM parameters for any newly added Allocator Vault type shall default to match the parameters defined herein for the ALLOCATOR-SPARK-A vault type.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Allocator Vault Parameters - ALLOCATOR-SPARK-A Parameters Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Allocator Vault Parameters - ALLOCATOR-SPARK-A Parameters Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters for the ALLOCATOR-SPARK-A Allocator Vault are as follows:
  • max - 3,000 basis points,
  • min - 0 basis points,
  • step - 400 basis points,
  • tau - Globally defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value.

  • max - 3,000 basis points,

  • min - 0 basis points,
  • step - 400 basis points,
  • tau - Globally defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments Core All Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module parameters can be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators Core The Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module (SP-BEAM) Operator is a whitelisted entity that can directly alter the current parameters of vault types or savings rates that have been added to the SP-BEAM. Changes to rates are limited by the max, min, step, and tau parameters. Operators can be added or removed by an Executive Vote.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig Core The Operator Multisig is the Operator of the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module and is controlled by Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Address Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Address Core The address of the Operator Multisig on the Ethereum Mainnet is 0xe1c6f81D0c3CD570A77813b81AA064c5fff80309.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Required Number Of Signers Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Required Number Of Signers Core The Operator Multisig currently has a 2/3 signing requirement.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Signers Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Signers Core The signers of the Operator Multisig are three (3) addresses controlled by Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Usage Standards Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Usage Standards Core The signers of the Operator Multisig must use the multisig to operate the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module in accordance with the instructions specified in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Modification Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Modification Core Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis can change the signers of the Operator Multisig at any time, so long as there are at least three (3) signers and at least a majority of signers are required to execute transactions.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Update Process Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Operators - Operator Update Process Core Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module Operators can be modified by the Stability Facilitators, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process Core The rates set by the Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module (SP-BEAM) are managed by the SP-BEAM Operators. The SP-BEAM Operators' use of this authority must wholly adhere to instructions provided by the Core Council Risk Advisor.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Request By Core Council Risk Advisor Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Request By Core Council Risk Advisor Core Any requests to change rates set by the SP-BEAM must be posted to the Sky Forum by the Core Council Risk Advisor that is recommending the change.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Operator Execution Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Operator Execution Core Once a rate change request has been posted to the Sky Forum by the Core Council Risk Advisor, the SP-BEAM Operators must prepare and execute the proposed changes in a timely manner. Preparation can include the creation of transaction simulations to verify inputs.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Public Communication Measures For Endgame Transition - Stability Parameter Bounded External Access Module - Update Process - Public Communication Core Once a change in rates set by the SP-BEAM has been executed, the execution must be publicly communicated to the Sky Ecosystem. This communication may take the form of either (1) a Forum post or (2) inclusion of the execution in an informational dashboard that allows community members to see each rate change executed by the SP-BEAM.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers Core Keeper networks provide critical services for the back-end systems of Sky, enhancing protocol security and efficiency. There are multiple providers of keeper networks in the Sky Ecosystem, decentralizing the keepers and ensuring redundancy. The subdocuments herein specify ongoing payment streams to compensate the different providers of keeper networks.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Gelato Network Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Gelato Network Core

Gelato Network

Budget: 1,500 USDS per day
Stream Duration: 3 years (start date 29 May 2023).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Keep3r Network Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Keep3r Network Core

Keep3r Network

Budget: 1,500 USDS per day
Stream Duration: 3 years (start date 29 May 2023).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Chainlink Automation Measures For Endgame Transition - Keepers - Chainlink Automation Core

Chainlink Automation

Budget: 1,500 USDS per day
Stream Duration: 3 years (start date 29 May 2023).
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process Core The subdocuments herein define the process by which Sky vault users should be notified about collateral offboarding.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Legacy Context Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Legacy Context Core

Periodically, collateral and vault types (ilks) are re-evaluated, which sometimes results in an offboarding of that collateral or vault type.

There have been several instances where users entered official Sky forums/chats to understand why they had been suddenly liquidated, despite historically comfortable collateralization ratios (https://forum.sky.money/t/an-assessment-first-hand-experience-and-recommendations-from-the-aave-offboarding/11836). This is, understandably, a poor user experience.

Even with liquidation penalties set to 0%, the forced unwinding of levered positions conceivably can result in user losses, as well as potentially taxable events.

This Section defines procedures concerning the dissemination of information about upcoming collateral offboarding on a best-effort basis. The objective is to minimize the number of users who are unaware of the offboarding prior to getting their positions liquidated.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Legacy Context Specific Goals Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Legacy Context Specific Goals Core Specific Goals:
  1. Codify a series of good-faith communication efforts.
  2. Provide an easy-to-follow process for Sky contributors to follow without significant burden.
  3. Minimize the number of users unaware of a collateral offboarding.
  4. Provide a method to bypass these requirements in the event a collateral is being offboarded due to serious security or solvency concerns.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Technical Process Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Technical Process Core The subdocuments herein specify actions to be taken by specific actors within Sky when offboarding a vault type.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Immediate Actions Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Immediate Actions Core Upon approval by Sky Governance to offboard a permissionless collateral type or vault type, the following actions are taken as soon as is practicable:
  • Set debt ceiling to zero (0) Dai or USDS.
  • Make an initial public announcement on all communication channels listed in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Communication Channels And Media Assets Listing.
  • Make a second public announcement on all communication channels in the above cited document no later than 14 calendar days after the initial public announcement.
  • Once the second public announcements have been made, set the liquidation penalty to 0%.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Following Actions Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Following Actions Core Parameter changes designed to offboard users, such as changes to the liquidation ratio or stability fee, can only be implemented once 14 calendar days have passed following a second public announcement.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Communication Channels And Media Assets Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Communication Channels And Media Assets Active Data Controller

The process for adding, removing, and modifying communication channels and media assets, and the order of announcement publication, are defined as Active Data in A.3.9 - Communication Channels And Media Assets Listing.

The Active Data is updated as follows:

  • The Responsible Party is Core GovOps.
  • The Update Process must follow the protocol for 'Direct Edit'.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Expedited Offboarding Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Expedited Offboarding Core The subdocuments herein define an expedited offboarding process in the event a collateral type needs to be removed quickly due to security or solvency concerns.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Requirements Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Requirements Core

When a collateral type threatens the security or solvency of the Sky Protocol, an expedited offboarding is in order. Expedited offboardings override the timeline specified in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Technical Process and allow the immediate modification of all relevant parameters.

Expedited offboardings must proceed pursuant to the following requirements:

  • The Offboarding Proposal must state that the offboarding should be expedited due to an emergency or urgent concern, as defined in A.1.8 - Emergency Response System - Emergency Response - Definition Of Emergency Situations.
  • The Offboarding Proposal must explicitly reference this Atlas document.
A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Announcements Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Announcements Core The public announcements defined in A.3.9 - Measures For Endgame Transition - Offboarding Process - Technical Process must still be carried out. However, the timing of these announcements no longer constrains the modification of parameters. These announcements must also state that the offboarding is being expedited and explain the reasons for this accelerated process.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop Genesis Capital Backstop Core If a "SKY Backstop Event" is in progress and the SKY price equals zero, the Sky Protocol must apply a pro-rata haircut across each Genesis Agent's Genesis Capital, implemented as a transfer of eligible assets from each Agent to the Sky Surplus Buffer. The haircut must be sized exactly to restore the Surplus Buffer to zero.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Implementation Genesis Capital Backstop - Implementation Core

In the near term, transfers are made through Executive Votes and may be made through Emergency Spells (see A.1.9 - A4 - Sky Core Governance Security - Emergency Spells) as part of the Emergency Response System (see A.1.8 - A1 - Emergency Response System - Emergency Response)

A solution must be developed to allow these transfers to be accomplished on an automated basis without waiting for the GSM Pause Delay (see A.1.9 - A2 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements).

.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Post Backstop Settlement Genesis Capital Backstop - Post Backstop Settlement Core

If the haircut restores the Surplus Buffer to zero (i.e., the deficit is fully cleared), Sky will distribute 24 billion SKY to Genesis Agents, in proportion to the amount each Agent lost in the haircut.

If, after the haircut, the Surplus Buffer remains below zero (i.e., the deficit could not be fully cleared), Sky will adjust the USDS target price below $1 to the extent necessary to settle the remaining deficit; Sky will then distribute 24 billion SKY to USDS holders via an airdrop.

.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Agent Capital Shortfalls Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Agent Capital Shortfalls Core Transfers of capital from Genesis Agents may cause capital shortfalls for Genesis Agents under the Risk Framework (see A.3.3). Sky will work in good faith with such Agents to waive penalties for a reasonable period of time to allow the Agents to rebuild their capital.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Relation To SKY Backstop Genesis Capital Backstop - Relation To SKY Backstop Core The Genesis Capital Backstop may not be invoked unless a "SKY Backstop Event" is in progress and the price of SKY equals zero.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Agents Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Agents Core Genesis Agents are Agents that receive capital contributions from Sky, including, without limitation:
  • Spark
  • Grove
  • Keel
  • Launch Agent 3
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Capital Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Capital Core The Genesis Capital of an Agent is the lesser of (1) the amount of capital contributed by Sky to the Agent and (2) the total capital of the Agent.
A.3.9 - Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Capital - Amount Of Capital Contributed By Sky To Agents Genesis Capital Backstop - Genesis Capital - Amount Of Capital Contributed By Sky To Agents Core The amount of capital contributed by Sky to Agents is:
  • Spark - 25,000,000 USDS
A.4.1 - A1 - Core Tokens - USDS Core Tokens - USDS Section USDS is the Stablecoin product of the Sky Protocol. It is designed to remain stable against USD, and its supply is regulated through the Peg Stability Module and the Allocation System, as governed by the Stability Scope.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - USDS - USDS Launch Core Tokens - USDS - USDS Launch Core In the Endgame Token Launch Phase, USDS is launched as an upgrade to Dai, offering new features, including Token Rewards. Dai can be exchanged to and from USDS at a rate of 1:1.
A.4.1 - A2 - Core Tokens - SKY Core Tokens - SKY Section SKY is the governance token of the Sky Protocol. It grants voting rights in the Sky Governance system. Its liquidity is boosted by the Smart Burn Engine, as governed by the Stability Scope.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Core Historically, MKR was the governance token of the Sky Protocol. As part of the transition to the Endgame, the technical infrastructure of the Sky Protocol must be upgraded to use SKY as its governance token rather than MKR. The upgrade will take place over three phases, as defined in the documents herein.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Approval Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Approval Core MKR Holders have voted to approve the deprecation of MKR as the governance token of the Sky Protocol with full knowledge of the changes being proposed. See https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmcZNZg3. This deprecation includes all actions defined in A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade, including, but not limited to, the removal of voting rights from MKR and the Delayed Upgrade Penalty.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Core The documents herein define Phase One of the upgrade from MKR to SKY as the governance token of the Protocol.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Timing Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Timing Core Phase One is expected to occur in the May 15, 2025 Executive Vote.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Actions Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase One Actions Core The actions specified in the documents herein will be taken as part of Phase One. These actions are authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Disable Conversion From SKY To MKR In Existing Conversion Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Disable Conversion From SKY To MKR In Existing Conversion Contract Core The functionality to convert SKY to MKR in the existing converter contract located at 0xBDcFCA946b6CDd965f99a839e4435Bcdc1bc470B on the Ethereum Mainnet must be disabled.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New MKR To SKY Conversion Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New MKR To SKY Conversion Contract Core A new contract that allows upgrading from MKR to SKY must be deployed. This contract must have the following features:
  • it must allow upgrading from MKR to SKY at a conversion rate of 1 MKR to 24,000 SKY, subject to the Delayed Upgrade Penalty specified below;
  • it must not allow conversion from SKY to MKR;
  • it must support charging a Delayed Upgrade Penalty set by Sky Governance, which applies to all upgrades of MKR to SKY; and
  • the Delayed Upgrade Penalty must initially be set to 0%.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Disable MKR Flop Auctions Core Tokens - SKY - Disable MKR Flop Auctions Core MKR flop auctions must be disabled.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Disable Emergency Shutdown Module Core Tokens - SKY - Disable Emergency Shutdown Module Core The Emergency Shutdown Module must be disabled by setting the amount of MKR required to trigger it to infinity.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New Chief Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New Chief Contract Core A new Chief contract must be deployed to support voting with SKY instead of MKR. The following changes must be made to support upgrade to the new Chief contract:
  • the ds-pause contract must be set to be operated by the new Chief contract;
  • all MOM contracts must be set to be operated by the new Chief contract;
  • the maxYays parameter in the new Chief contract must be set to 5;
  • the launchThreshold in the new Chief contract must be set to 2,400,000,000 SKY (equivalent to 100,000 MKR); and
  • the liftCooldown must be set to 10 blocks.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Move Authority Of Spark Freezer MOM Contract To New Chief Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Move Authority Of Spark Freezer MOM Contract To New Chief Contract Core A Spark Spell must be triggered to move the authority of the Spark Freezer MOM contract to the new Chief contract. See A.1.9 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements - SparkLend Freezer Mom Exception.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New SKY Oracle Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New SKY Oracle Core A new Oracle Security Module based on the Scribe SKY oracle must be deployed.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Add New SKY Oracle to Oracle Security Module MOM Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Add New SKY Oracle to Oracle Security Module MOM Contract Core The new SKY oracle must be added to the OSM_MOM contract. See A.1.9 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements - Oracle Freeze Exception.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Update Smart Burn Engine Parameters Core Tokens - SKY - Update Smart Burn Engine Parameters Core The parameters of the Smart Burn Engine must be updated as follows:
  • The oracle must be changed to the new SKY oracle; and
  • The rewardsDuration for the LSEV2-SKY-A USDS rewards contract must be set such that it is equal to the splitter.hop parameter.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Launch SKY Staking Core Tokens - SKY - Launch SKY Staking Core SKY Staking must be launched with the following parameters for borrowing against staked SKY:
  • Ilk: LSEV2-SKY-A
  • Farms:
    • LSSKY → USDS (0x38E4254bD82ED5Ee97CD1C4278FAae748d998865)
    • LSSKY → SPK (0x99cBC0e4E6427F6939536eD24d1275B95ff77404)
  • Fee: 0
  • DC-IAM line: Set at discretion of Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor
  • DC-IAM gap: Set at discretion of Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor
  • DC-IAM ttl: Set at discretion of Stability Facilitators in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor
  • Only existing LSE-MKR-A users with drawn debt are allowed to migrate debt to LSEV2-SKY-A initially
  • Dust: 30,000
  • Duty: 20%
  • Mat: 145%
  • Calc: StairstepExponentialDecrease
  • Buf: 120%
  • Tail: 6,000 seconds
  • Cusp: 40%
  • Chip: 0.1%
  • Tip: 300 USDS
  • Stopped: 3
  • Chop: 13%
  • Hole: 250,000
  • Tau: 0 days
  • Cut: 0.99
  • Step: 60 seconds
  • LineMom: Yes
  • Tolerance: 0.5
  • Name: LockstakeSky
  • Symbol: lsSKY
  • Use new SKY Chronicle Scribe oracle instance OSM
  • Deny the CLIPPER_MOM from the new lockstake clipper
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Deploy New Vote Delegate Factory Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Deploy New Vote Delegate Factory Contract Core A new Vote Delegate factory contract must be deployed. The Vote Delegate factory contract must support deploying Delegate Contracts to which SKY holders and SKY Staking users can delegate their voting power.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Core The documents herein define Phase Two of the upgrade from MKR to SKY as the governance token of the Protocol.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Timing Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Timing Core Phase Two is expected to occur in the May 29, 2025 Executive Vote.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Actions Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Actions Core The actions specified in the documents herein will be taken as part of Phase Two. These actions are authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Update Parameters For Staked Sky Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Two Actions Core The parameters for staked SKY must be updated as follows:
  • USDS rewards on the LSEV2-SKY-A contract must be activated by setting the splitter.burn parameter to 50%;
  • the maxLine parameter must be set to 50,000,000 USDS;
  • the gap parameter must be set to 25,000,000;
  • the ttl parameter must be set to 86,400 seconds; and
  • the autoline parameter must be enabled.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Adjust GSM Pause Delay Core Tokens - SKY - Adjust GSM Pause Delay Core The GSM Pause Delay must be set to 24 hours. See A.1.9 - Sky Core Governance Security - Governance Security Delay Requirements - Pause Delay Current Value.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Revoke Migrator Authority Over Vat Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Revoke Migrator Authority Over Vat Contract Core The Migrator contract authority over the Vat contract must be revoked. This authority was necessary for existing users of LSE-MKR-A to migrate to LSEV2-SKY-A but is no longer required.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Core The documents herein define Phase Three of the upgrade from MKR to SKY as the governance token of the Protocol.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Timing Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Timing Core Phase Three will occur in Executive Votes subsequent to the May 29, 2025 Executive Vote. Unlike Phases One and Two, Phase Three will occur over multiple future Executive Votes.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Actions Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Phase Three Actions Core The actions specified in the documents herein will be taken as part of Phase Three. These actions are authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Develop SKY Flop Auctions Core Tokens - SKY - Develop SKY Flop Auctions Core Functionality for SKY flop auctions must be developed.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Offboard Borrowing Against Staked MKR Core Tokens - SKY - Offboard Borrowing Against Staked MKR Core Seal Engine (LSE-MKR-A) must be offboarded as a collateral type. This will require retiring the existing SKY wrapped oracle and removing it from the MegaPoker keeper as well as other actions that will be identified at a future date.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Upgrade MKR In Pause Proxy To SKY Core Tokens - SKY - Upgrade MKR In Pause Proxy To SKY Core The MKR in the Pause Proxy contract must be upgraded to SKY.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Update Liquidation Parameters For Borrowing Against Staked SKY Core Tokens - SKY - Update Liquidation Parameters For Borrowing Against Staked SKY Core Once sufficient liquidity has been attained, liquidations must be enabled and parameters for LSEV2-SKY-A must be updated to normal levels.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Set Conversion Fee In MKR To SKY Conversion Contract To 1% Core Tokens - SKY - Set Conversion Fee In MKR To SKY Conversion Contract To 1% Core In the September 18, 2025 Executive Vote, the Delayed Upgrade Penalty for the new MKR to SKY conversion contract (see A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Launch New MKR To SKY Conversion Contract) must be set to 1%. Thereafter, the Delayed Upgrade Penalty must be increased gradually at the rate of 1 percentage point per three months.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Modification Of Phases Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Modification Of Phases Core The timing and contents of Phase One, Phase Two, and Phase Three may be adjusted by the Protocol Facilitators in consultation with relevant Ecosystem Actors.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Deflationary Tokenomics Core Tokens - SKY - Deflationary Tokenomics Core The documents herein set forth the core deflationary tokenomics of the SKY token.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Initial Token Supply Core Tokens - SKY - Initial Token Supply Core The initial token supply of SKY tokens is derived from the total number of legacy MKR tokens as of the launch of Sky, multiplied by the conversion ratio of 24,000. SKY is the exclusive governance token of the Sky Protocol and takes over all governance and economic rights previously held by MKR. See A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Upgrade Approval.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - No New Token Emissions Core Tokens - SKY - No New Token Emissions Core No new SKY tokens may be emitted except for (1) emissions required to recapitalize the protocol if it is at risk of insolvency (see A.3.7) and (2) temporary emissions that are being deprecated and fully offset by corresponding burns, resulting in no net increase to the intended long-term token supply (see A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Deprecated Emissions Mechanisms).
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Burning of Existing Tokens Core Tokens - SKY - Burning of Existing Tokens Core At the same time that no new SKY tokens are issued, SKY tokens are bought back and burned on a regular basis, using a portion of the Net Revenue of the Protocol as dictated by the Treasury Management Function. See A.2.5 - Treasury Management - Treasury Management - Allocation Steps - Step 4: Smart Burn And Standard Activity Staking Rewards - Smart Burn Buffer. As a result, the total supply of SKY tokens will continue to decrease over time.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Deprecated Emissions Mechanisms Core Tokens - SKY - Deprecated Emissions Mechanisms Core The subdocuments herein define legacy mechanisms involving the issuance of new SKY tokens. Each of these mechanisms is being deprecated. While these mechanisms do not increase the net supply of SKY tokens, they must be replaced with solutions that do not involve any emissions of SKY tokens, as defined in the documents herein.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - SKY Token Rewards Emissions Core Tokens - SKY - SKY Token Rewards Emissions Core

USDS users are able to earn SKY Rewards. See A.4.3 - A2 - Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Token Reward Mechanism. These rewards are currently funded by emissions of new SKY tokens.

These ongoing emissions will be eliminated and replaced with a solution that funds these rewards using SKY held by the Sky Protocol.

At the same time that this new solution is implemented, SKY tokens equal to the total SKY emissions previously used to fund SKY Rewards, including the Early Bird Reward (see A.5.5 - Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward - Token Distribution), will be burned from SKY held by the Sky Protocol.

The combination of these actions will achieve a state where the number of total SKY tokens is exactly the same as if SKY Rewards had never been funded with protocol emissions.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Conversion Emissions Core Tokens - SKY - MKR To SKY Conversion Emissions Core

The legacy MKR to SKY conversion contract (Legacy Conversion Contract) burns MKR and mints new SKY. The new MKR to SKY conversion contract (New Conversion Contract) instead burns MKR and issues SKY from the existing supply of preminted SKY.

The Legacy Conversion Contract will be disabled as specified in 4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Disabling Legacy Conversion Contract. To offset SKY minted by the Legacy Conversion Contract after the deployment of the New Conversion Contract, an equivalent amount of preminted SKY will be burned. This action will ensure the total SKY token supply remains as if these specific emissions from the Legacy Conversion Contract had not occurred.
A.4.1 - Core Tokens - SKY - Disabling Legacy Conversion Contract Core Tokens - SKY - Disabling Legacy Conversion Contract Core The disabling of the Legacy Conversion Contract will be executed in the June 26, 2025 Executive Vote. This action is authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.2 - A1 - SkyLink - Multichain Support Native Mechanisms SkyLink - Multichain Support Native Mechanisms Section SkyLink deployments support features including the Savings Rate Mechanism (including sUSDS), the Token Rewards Mechanism and the SKY Staking Mechanism.
A.4.3 - A1 - Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Savings Rates Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Savings Rates Section The Savings Rate Mechanism includes both the legacy Dai Savings Rate Mechanism and the Sky Savings Rate. The Sky Savings Rate includes a built-in sUSDS mechanism. The Savings Rate is governed by the Stability Scope.
A.4.3 - A2 - Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Token Reward Mechanism Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Token Reward Mechanism Section The Token Rewards Mechanism provides SKY rewards to USDS users. Agent tokens are also distributed through a Token Rewards Mechanism.
A.4.3 - Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Token Reward Mechanism - SKY Token Rewards Savings Rate And Token Reward Mechanism - Token Reward Mechanism Core

With each Executive Vote, the distribution of SKY token rewards to USDS holders is normalized to ensure the effective yield provided by these rewards equals the Sky Savings Rate (SSR) for the upcoming period. The effective yield is defined as: (Total Market Value of Distributed SKY Tokens / Total Eligible USDS Balance).

To achieve this normalization, the quantity of SKY token rewards to be distributed is determined through the following calculation, performed for each normalization period:

  1. Determine Target Reward Value: Calculate the total US dollar value required to meet the SSR for the period: (Total Eligible USDS Balance * SSR).
  2. Determine SKY Token Quantity: Divide the Target Reward Value (from step 1) by the Current Market Price of SKY (determined at the time of the Executive Vote).
The Core Facilitator, on the recommendation of the Core Council Risk Advisor, may maintain the quantity of SKY token rewards to be distributed for a normalization period at its current level if they conclude that:
  • the difference between the effective yield provided by SKY Tokens Rewards and the SSR is not material;
  • the difference between the effective yield provided by SKY Token Rewards and the SSR is unlikely to persist due to other factors; or
  • adjusting the quantity of SKY Token Rewards is otherwise inadvisable.
The recommendation of the Core Council Risk Advisor must be posted to the Sky Forum.
A.4.4 - A1 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking Section SKY holders can stake their tokens via the SKY Staking Mechanism available on Ethereum Mainnet and SkyLink Deployments. SKY stakers earn voting rewards sourced from the Sky Treasury Management Function. In lieu of USDS rewards and SKY rewards, SKY stakers can choose to earn Agent Token Rewards, including SPK and the tokens of other Prime Agents incubated by Sky. SKY stakers can also borrow USDS against their staked collateral using the SKY-backed borrowing mechanism defined herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards Core The documents herein define the SKY Staking Voting Rewards. SKY stakers may choose between receiving USDS or Agent Token rewards.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards Core SKY stakers are eligible to receive voting rewards sourced from the Sky Treasury Management Function (TMF) or the Agent Token Distribution mechanism defined in A.4.5.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards Core USDS rewards are distributed via two distinct mechanisms based on the staker's activity level: the High Activity Staking Reward (HASR) and the Standard Activity Staking Reward (SASR). SASR is the base reward when funding from the Treasury Management Function is available; HASR is an additional boost reserved for High-Activity wallets. See A.2.5 - Treasury Management - Treasury Management - Allocation Steps - Step 2: High Activity Staking Rewards - Payout From High Activity Staking Rewards Buffer.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - Activity Levels SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - Activity Levels Core At the Monthly Settlement Cycle, all SKY-staking wallets are tagged as High Activity or Standard Activity, pursuant to the criteria defined in A.2.5 - Treasury Management - Treasury Management - Allocation Steps - Step 2: High Activity Staking Rewards - High Activity Staker Qualification and A.2.5 - Treasury Management - Treasury Management - Allocation Steps - Step 4: Smart Burn And Standard Activity Staking Rewards - Standard Activity Staking Rewards - Standard Activity Staker Qualification. Only High Activity wallets share HASR; both High and Standard Activity wallets share SASR.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - High Activity Staking Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - High Activity Staking Rewards Core The High Activity Staking Rewards (HASR) is a boosted reward provided to High Activity wallets. The HASR amount is distributed each monthly cycle pro-rata to the SKY stake of all High Activity wallets. High Activity wallets receive SASR (when funding is available) plus their separate HASR boost.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - Standard Activity Staking Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Treasury Management Function-Derived Voting Rewards - Standard Activity Staking Rewards Core The Standard Activity Staking Rewards (SASR) is the base reward shared by all wallets with Standard Activity status or higher. When funding is available, the SASR amount is distributed each monthly cycle pro‑rata to the SKY stake of every Standard or High Activity wallet.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Agent Token Distribution Voting Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY Staking Voting Rewards - Sources of Voting Rewards - Agent Token Distribution Voting Rewards Core SKY stakers are eligible to receive Agent Token rewards as specified in A.4.5. At the Monthly Settlement Cycle, Agent Tokens are distributed pro‑rata, by staked SKY, among wallets that have opted to receive a specific Agent Token for the cycle. To qualify for Agent Token payout a wallet must satisfy the Standard Activity criteria specified in A.2.5 - Treasury Management - Treasury Management - Allocation Steps - Step 4: Smart Burn And Standard Activity Staking Rewards - Standard Activity Staking Rewards - Payout From Standard Activity Staking Rewards Buffer.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing Core SKY stakers can borrow USDS against their staked SKY collateral. This borrowing will be facilitated exclusively by the stUSDS system which will provide protocol-independent, or segregated, risk capital. The stUSDS system is currently in development; its elements are outlined in the subdocuments below. During the transition period to the stUSDS system, the protocol-dependent SKY-backed borrowing system remains operational and is governed by A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Function SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Function Core stUSDS is a yield-bearing token representing USDS deposited into the stUSDS contract. Its primary function is to provide segregated risk capital for the SKY-backed borrowing mechanism. Users convert USDS to stUSDS to provide this capital and earn the stUSDS Rate. See A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate. stUSDS can be converted back to USDS subject to available unutilized liquidity in the stUSDS converter contract.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate Core The variable yield earned by stUSDS holders is calculated using the formula:

            stUSDS Rate = Sky Savings Rate + (SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate) * Utilization - Rfactor * f(Utilization)
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition Core The parameters of the stUSDS Rate formula are further defined in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Sky Savings Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Sky Savings Rate Definition Core Sky Savings Rate is the Sky Savings Rate defined in A.3.2 - Core Stability Parameters - Parameters - Sky Savings Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - SKY Borrow Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - SKY Borrow Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Rate is the SKY Borrow Rate defined in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Minimum Rate is the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate defined in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition Core Utilization is the percent of funds in the stUSDS contract that are used to fund borrowing against staked SKY.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation Core The Utilization is calculated as a time-weighted utilization over a one (1) day interval.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization Core The documents herein define the process to calculate time-weighted utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Determine Start And End Times SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Determine Start And End Times Core First, the start time $T_{0}$ and end time $T_{n}$ of the interval, over which time-weighted utilization are to be calculated, are selected.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Collect Borrow And Supply Events SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Collect Borrow And Supply Events Core Data is then collected on all supply and borrow events, sorted by time, where:
  • $t_{i}$ is the timestamp of event $i$;
  • $B_{i}$ is the total amount borrowed at time $t_{i}$;
  • $S_{i}$ is the total amount supplied at time $t_{i}$; and
  • $U_{i}$ is the utilization at time $t_{i}$, $\frac{B_{i}}{S_{i}}$.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Insert Synthetic Events SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Insert Synthetic Events Core If $t_{0}$ is greater than $T_{0}$ then a synthetic event is inserted at $T_{0}$ with values $B_{0}$ and $S_{0}$. Similarly, if $t_{n}$ is less than $T_{n}$ then a synthetic event is inserted at $T_{n}$ with values $B_{n}$ and $S_{n}$.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Calculate Time-Weighted Utilization SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Calculate Time-Weighted Utilization Core

Finally, the time-weighted utilization is calculated using the following formula:

$$\text{Util}_{\mathrm{avg}} = \frac{\sum_{i=0}^{n-1} U_i \cdot (t_{i+1} - t_i)}{T_n - T_0}$$
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Reference Implementation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Definition - Utilization Calculation - Time-Weighted Utilization - Reference Implementation Core A reference implementation of the time-weighted utilization formula is included herein. The reference implementation uses sample data and a 30 day interval for illustrative purposes. 

            # Your list of real events: (timestamp, total_borrowed, total_supply)
            events = [
            (datetime(2025, 7, 25, 10), 100_000, 200_000),
            (datetime(2025, 7, 25, 16), 120_000, 210_000),
            (datetime(2025, 7, 26, 8), 130_000, 220_000),
            (datetime(2025, 7, 27, 12), 110_000, 215_000),
            (datetime(2025, 7, 28, 9), 140_000, 225_000),
            ]

            # Ensure events are sorted
            events.sort()

            # Get time window
            now = datetime.utcnow()
            start_time = now - timedelta(days=30)

            # Add synthetic first event (30d ago) using earliest known borrow/supply
            first_real_ts, first_borrow, first_supply = events[0]
            if first_real_ts > start_time:
            events.insert(0, (start_time, first_borrow, first_supply))

            # Add synthetic final event (now) using most recent known borrow/supply
            last_real_ts, last_borrow, last_supply = events[-1]
            if last_real_ts < now:
            events.append((now, last_borrow, last_supply))

            # Step 1: Compute utilization per event
            utilizations = []
            for ts, borrow, supply in events:
            utilization = borrow / supply if supply != 0 else 0
            utilizations.append((ts, utilization))

            # Step 2: Compute time-weighted utilization average
            weighted_sum = 0
            total_time = 0

            for i in range(len(utilizations) - 1):
            ts1, util1 = utilizations[i]
            ts2, _ = utilizations[i + 1]

            time_diff = (ts2 - ts1).total_seconds()
            weighted_sum += util1 * time_diff
            total_time += time_diff

            avg_utilization = weighted_sum / total_time if total_time > 0 else 0

            print(f"30-day time-weighted average utilization: {avg_utilization:.2%}")
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition Core

Rfactor is calculated using the formula:

$$Rfactor = \frac{2u_m - 1}{2u_m \left( u_{opt}(\alpha + 1) - 1 + \frac{\beta u_{opt}}{slope1} \right)}$$

The parameters of this formula are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Definition Core $u_{m}$ is the maximum profit utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Definition - Maximum Profit Utilization Current Value Core The current value of $u_{m}$ is 70%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Target Utilization Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Target Utilization Definition Core $u_{opt}$ is the target utilization specified in A.4.4 Rate Setting Mechanism.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition Core

$\alpha$ is calculated using the formula:

alpha = ((SKY Borrow Maximum Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate) / Slope 1) - 1

The parameters of this formula are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Maximum Rate is the maximum value of the SKY Borrow Rate at 100% Utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Current Value Core The current value of the SKY Borrow Maximum Rate is 30%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Minimum Rate is the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate specified in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - Slope 1 Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Alpha Definition - Slope 1 Definition Core Slope 1 is the Slope 1 parameter specified in A.4.4 - Slope 1.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Beta Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Beta Definition Core $\beta$ is a tuning parameter that determines how much profit is made at maximum utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Beta Definition - Beta Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Beta Definition - Beta Current Value Core The current value of $\beta$ is 100%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Slope 1 Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Rfactor Definition - Slope 1 Definition Core $slope1$ is the Slope 1 parameter specified in A.4.4 - Slope 1.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition Core

f(Utilization) is calculated using the formula:

f(Utilization) = Utilization * ((SKY Borrow Maximum Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate + Beta) * Utilization + SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - SKY Borrow Rate)

The parameters of this formula are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - Utilization Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - Utilization Definition Core Utilization is the utilization as specified in A.4.4 - Utilization Definition.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Maximum Rate is the SKY Borrow Maximum Rate specified in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Maximum Rate Definition.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Minimum Rate is the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate specified in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Definition.
