A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - Beta Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - Beta Definition Core Beta is the beta specified in A.4.4 - Beta Definition.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Definition - Utilization Function Definition - SKY Borrow Rate Definition Core SKY Borrow Rate is the SKY Borrow Rate specified in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Rate - Parameters Modification Core The parameters specified in A.4.4 - Parameters Definition that are set by governance may be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Holders' Risk Bearing SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Holders' Risk Bearing Core Holders of stUSDS accept the risk associated with providing capital for SKY-backed borrowing. In the event that the liquidation of a borrower's staked SKY collateral does not cover the outstanding debt, stUSDS balances will be subject to a haircut proportional to the shortfall. This mechanism ensures that the Sky Protocol is isolated from losses originating from the SKY-backed borrowing facility.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - Debt Ceiling SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - Debt Ceiling Core The maximum amount of USDS that can be borrowed against staked SKY is dynamically determined by, and equal to, the total amount of USDS currently held within the stUSDS contract. This dynamic ceiling will replace the static DC-IAM module and parameters associated with protocol-dependent, SKY-backed borrowing.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate Core The interest rate charged to borrowers (SKY Borrow Rate) is dynamic and market-driven, based on the utilization of funds within the stUSDS contract. This dynamic rate will replace the static Stability Fee parameter associated with protocol-dependent, SKY-backed borrowing.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism Core

The SKY Borrow Rate adjusts to target a 90% utilization rate of the USDS in the stUSDS contract. When stUSDS utilization is below 90%, the rate gradually decreases; when above 90%, it gradually increases. The SKY Borrow Rate cannot fall below the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate. See A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate.

The specific parameters and formula governing the rate of adjustment are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters Core The parameters of the rate setting mechanism are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Utilization SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Utilization Core Utilization is the percentage of funds in the stUSDS contract that are used to fund borrowing against staked SKY specified in A.4.4 - Utilization Definition.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Target Utilization SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Target Utilization Core Target Utilization is the target utilization rate of USDS in the stUSDS contract specified in A.4.4 Rate Setting Mechanism.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Core SKY Borrow Minimum Rate is the rate that the SKY Borrow Rate cannot fall below specified in A.4.4 - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 Core Slope 1 represents the spread of the SKY Borrow Rate over the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate when Utilization is at Target Utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 - Slope 1 Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 - Slope 1 Current Value Core The current value of the Slope 1 parameter is 12.575%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 - Slope 1 Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 1 - Slope 1 Modification Core The Slope 1 parameter may be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 Core Slope 2 represents the spread of the SKY Borrow Rate at 100% Utilization over the SKY Borrow Rate at Target Utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Current Value Core The current value of the Slope 2 parameter is 12.575%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Modification Core The Slope 2 parameter may be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology Core

Under normal circumstances governance should set the Slope 2 parameter based on the following formula:

Slope 2 = Slope 1 * alpha

The parameters of this formula are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology - Slope 1 Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology - Slope 1 Definition Core The Slope 1 parameter is specified in A.4.4 - Slope 1.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology - Alpha Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Parameters - Slope 2 - Slope 2 Methodology - Alpha Definition Core The alpha parameter is specified in A.4.4 - Alpha Definition.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Formula SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - Rate Setting Mechanism - Rate Setting Formula Core

The Sky Borrow Rate is calculated according to the following formula when Utilization is less than or equal to Target Utilization:

SKY Borrow Rate = SKY Borrow Minimum Rate + Utilization / Target Utilization * Slope 1

The SKY Borrow Rate is calculated according to the following formula when Utilization is greater than Target Utilization:

SKY Borrow Rate = SKY Borrow Minimum Rate + Slope 1 + (Utilization - Target Utilization) / (1 - Target Utilization) * Slope 2
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate Core The SKY Borrow Minimum Rate is calculated according to the following formula:

            SKY Borrow Minimum Rate = Sky Savings Rate + stUSDS Accessibility Reward

The formula ensures the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate covers the baseline cost of capital (Sky Savings Rate) plus the incentive cost (stUSDS Accessibility Reward), preventing value-draining arbitrage where users could borrow below the Sky Savings Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - Sky Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition Core The parameters of the SKY Borrow Minimum Rate formula are further defined in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition - Sky Savings Rate Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition - Sky Savings Rate Definition Core Sky Savings Rate is defined in A.3.2 - Core Stability Parameters - Parameters - Sky Savings Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition - stUSDS Distribution Reward Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY Borrow Rate - SKY Borrow Minimum Rate - Parameters Definition - stUSDS Distribution Reward Definition Core stUSDS Distribution Reward is defined in A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Accessibility Reward.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters Core The liquidation parameters for SKY-backed loans funded via stUSDS are:
  • Liquidation Ratio: 125%
  • Calc: StairstepExponentialDecrease
  • Tau: 0 days
  • Tolerance: 0.5
  • Cut: 0.99
  • Step: 60 seconds
  • Buf: 120%
  • Cusp: 40%
  • Tail: 6,000 seconds
  • Chip: 0.1%
  • Stopped: 3
  • Tip: 300 USDS
  • Chop: 13%
  • Hole: 250,000
  • Dust: 30,000
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Risk Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Risk Parameters Core Except as specified in A.4.4 - Modification Of stUSDS Auction Parameters, the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, have the ability to modify any of the parameters defined in A.4.4 - stUSDS Risk Parameters. The modification of said parameters is pursuant to the Operational Weekly Cycle and can be effected directly via an Executive Vote, without requiring a Governance Poll.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Auction Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Risk Parameters - Modification Of stUSDS Auction Parameters Core A clear justification and analysis must be provided to validate any proposed changes to the Calc, Tau, Buf, Cusp, Tail, Chip, Tip, Chop, or Hole parameters. Before these changes are added to an Executive Vote, the Core Executor Agents must obtain approval through a Governance Poll. However, in an emergency, the Core Executor Agents have the authority to bypass the Governance Poll and add the proposed parameters directly to an Executive Vote. These parameters must be regularly monitored and updated if needed.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Accessibility Reward SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Accessibility Reward Core The stUSDS Distribution Reward is an incentive mechanism, similar to the USDS Accessibility Reward, designed to encourage Prime Agents and Integrators to promote stUSDS adoption. See A.2.4 - Distribution Reward Primitive. It is calculated as a percentage of the stUSDS balance associated with a Reward Code. The reward is initially set at 0.05% for the Integrator portion and 0.05% for the Prime Agent Management Fee, totaling 0.1%.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module Core The stUSDS Bounded External Access Module (stUSDS BEAM) enables designated, Governance-whitelisted operators to adjust the stUSDS Rate (str), the SKY Borrow Rate (duty), the maximum amount that users can deposit into the stUSDS contract (cap), and the maximum Debt Ceiling (line). Adjustments are governed by the stUSDS BEAM smart contract logic and specific parameters set by Sky Governance. stUSDS BEAM holds four parameters that can be set for each stUSDS parameter: (i) min, (ii) max, (iii) step, and (iv) tau.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions Core The documents herein define the parameters of the stUSDS BEAM.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Min Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Min Definition Core The min parameter defines the minimum value for the str and duty parameters that can be set using the stUSDS BEAM. Each of the str and duty parameters has a specific min.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Definition Core The max parameter defines the maximum value for the str and duty parameters that can be set using the stUSDS BEAM. Each of the str and duty parameters has a specific max.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Step Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Step Definition Core The step parameter limits how much the str and duty parameters can be increased or decreased in a single transaction, bound by the tau parameter. Each of the str and duty parameters has a specific step.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Cap Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Cap Definition Core The maxCap parameter defines the maximum value for the cap parameter that can be set by the stUSDS BEAM.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Cap Definition - Max Cap Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Cap Definition - Max Cap Current Value Core The maxCap is currently set to 1,000,000,000 USDS.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Line Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Line Definition Core The maxLine parameter defines the maximum value for the line parameter that can be set by the stUSDS BEAM.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Line Definition - Max Line Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Max Line Definition - Max Line Current Value Core The maxLine is currently set to 1,000,000,000 USDS.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition Core

The tau parameter defines the minimum time interval, in seconds, that must elapse between consecutive uses or operations of the stUSDS BEAM.

A stUSDS BEAM operation may adjust one or more parameters. Once a stUSDS BEAM operation is executed, the tau duration must expire before any subsequent stUSDS BEAM operation can be performed.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Definitions - Tau Definition - Tau Current Value Core The tau is currently set to 57,600 seconds (16 hours).
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters Core The stUSDS BEAM parameters for each stUSDS parameter set by the stUSDS BEAM are defined in the subdocuments herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters - Str Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters - Str Parameters Core The stUSDS BEAM parameters for the str stUSDS parameter are as follows:
  • max - 5,000 basis points,
  • min - 200 basis points,
  • step - 4,000 basis points.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters - Duty Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - stUSDS Parameters - Duty Parameters Core The stUSDS BEAM parameters for the duty stUSDS parameter are as follows:
  • max - 5,000 basis points,
  • min - 210 basis points,
  • step - 4,000 basis points.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments Core All stUSDS BEAM parameters can be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators Core The stUSDS BEAM Operators are whitelisted entities that can directly alter the stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM. Changes to stUSDS parameters are limited by the max, min, step, and tau parameters. Operators can be added or removed by an Executive Vote.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig Core The Operator Multisig is an Operator of the stUSDS BEAM and is controlled by Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Address Core The address of the Operator Multisig on the Ethereum Mainnet is 0xBB865F94B8A92E57f79fCc89Dfd4dcf0D3fDEA16.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Required Number Of Signers SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Required Number Of Signers Core The Operator Multisig currently has a 2/3 signing requirement.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Signers SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Signers Core The signers of the Operator Multisig are three (3) addresses controlled by Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Usage Standards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Usage Standards Core The signers of the Operator Multisig must use the multisig to operate the stUSDS BEAM in accordance with the instructions specified in A.4.4 - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Multisig - Operator Multisig Modification Core Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis can change the signers of the Operator Multisig at any time, so long as there are at least three (3) signers and at least a majority of signers are required to execute transactions.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet Core The Operator Hot Wallet is a hot wallet controlled by a bot that will update stUSDS parameters on an automated basis as specified in A.4.4 - Automatic Updates By Operator Hot Wallet. The wallet is controlled by Ecosystem Actor TechOps Services under the supervision of Core Executor Agent Atlas Axis in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. The addition of the Hot Wallet as an Operator of the stUSDS BEAM is authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet - Operator Hot Wallet Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet - Operator Hot Wallet Address Core The address of the Operator Hot Wallet on the Ethereum Mainnet is 0xd06C14820048de2Fb7c9de611EcFdaCE18eC8896.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet - Update Of stUSDS Parameters For Hot Wallet SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Hot Wallet - Update Of stUSDS Parameters For Hot Wallet Core When the Operator Hot Wallet is added as an Operator of the stUSDS Rate, the stUSDS BEAM parameters must be updated as follows:
  • The step parameters for the str and duty parameters must be reduced to 400 basis points; and
  • The tau parameter must be reduced to 4 hours.
These changes are authorized to proceed directly to an Executive Vote without a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Update Process SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Operators - Operator Update Process Core stUSDS BEAM Operators can be modified by the Core Executor Agents, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor. This process will be conducted through the Operational Weekly Governance Cycle or, if necessary, through out-of-schedule Executive Votes.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process Core The stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM are managed by the stUSDS BEAM Operators as specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Initial Parameter Values Set In Executive Vote SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Initial Parameter Values Set In Executive Vote Core The initial parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM in the Executive Vote deploying stUSDS and the stUSDS BEAM are:
  • str - 0 basis points
  • duty - 2,000 basis points
  • cap - 200,000,000 USDS
  • line - 200,000,000 USDS
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig Core Initially, the stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM are managed by the Operator Multisig based on instructions provided by the Core Council Risk Advisor.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Request By Core Council Risk Advisor SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Request By Core Council Risk Advisor Core Any requests to change stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM must be posted to the Sky Forum by the Core Council Risk Advisor recommending the change. Once Utilization is below 100% the Core Council Risk Advisor should begin recommending changes based on the methodology specified in A.4.4 - Update Methodology but may deviate from the values resulting from this methodology if they determine that other values are advisable to support the growth of stUSDS and the interests of the Sky Protocol.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Operator Execution SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Operator Execution Core Once a request to change stUSDS parameters has been posted to the Sky Forum by the Core Council Risk Advisor, the stUSDS BEAM Operators must prepare and execute the proposed changes in a timely manner. Preparation can include the creation of transaction simulations to verify inputs.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Public Communication SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig - Public Communication Core Once a change in stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM has been executed, the execution must be publicly communicated to the Sky Ecosystem. This communication may take the form of either (1) a Forum post or (2) inclusion of the execution in an informational dashboard that allows community members to see each stUSDS parameter change executed by the stUSDS BEAM.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Automatic Updates By Operator Hot Wallet SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Process - Automatic Updates By Operator Hot Wallet Core Once the Operator Hot Wallet has been added as an Operator of the stUSDS BEAM (see A.4.4 - Operator Hot Wallet), the stUSDS parameters set by the stUSDS BEAM must be set by the Operator Hot Wallet. These changes must be based on the update methodology specified in A.4.4 - Update Methodology and the results must be publicly visible on an information dashboard.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology Core The documents herein define the methodology that should be used for determining when and how to update stUSDS parameters with the stUSDS BEAM.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process Core Initially when stUSDS parameters are set manually by the Operator Multisig (see A.4.4 - Manual Parameter Updates By Operator Multisig), the Core Council Risk Advisor may deviate from the long term process specified in A.4.4 - Long Term Process in their best judgment based on the guidelines specified herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Initial Supply Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Initial Supply Rate Core The initial value of the str parameter must be set extraordinarily high to a value of approximately 40% initially to incentivize deposits. This rate is not sustainable and must be lowered as specified in A.4.4 - Gradual Reduction In Supply Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Gradual Reduction In Supply Rate SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Gradual Reduction In Supply Rate Core The str parameter must be gradually lowered to a more sustainable level as the market approaches the optimal target of 90% utilization.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Growth Of Market Size SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Short Term Process - Growth Of Market Size Core The cap and line parameters must be scaled up over time. By the time the market reaches 300,000,000 USDS the str parameter must be normalized to a level that is in line with the Interest Rate Model.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process Core Once the process is fully automated (see A.4.4 - Automatic Updates By Operator Hot Wallet) the automated process must fully conform to the specifications herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Conditions For Update SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Conditions For Update Core The stUSDS parameters should be updated if (1) the current Utilization (see A.4.4 - Utilization Definition) deviates from the Utilization as of the last time the stUSDS parameters were set by more than 2.4% and (2) the time since the last update is greater than tau (see A.4.4 - Tau Definition).
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update Core The new values for each stUSDS parameter should be set to be as close as possible to the values specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Str Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Str Calculation Core The str must be calculated as specified in A.4.4 - stUSDS Rate.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Duty Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Duty Calculation Core The duty must be calculated as specified in A.4.4 - Rate Setting Formula.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation Core The Core Council Risk Advisor must calculate the maximum amount that users can deposit into the stUSDS contract (cap) as specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation - Short Term Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation - Short Term Calculation Core In the short term while Utilization is above 100%, the cap must be set to 200,000,000 USDS.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation - Long Term Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Long Term Process - Calculations For Update - Cap Calculation - Long Term Calculation Core

In the long term, the cap must be gradually increased when Utilization is above 85% according to the following formula:

cap = 1.2 * current SKY borrowing
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation Core The Core Council Risk Advisor must calculate the maximum amount that users can borrow against their staked SKY (line) as specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation - Short Term Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation - Short Term Calculation Core In the short term while Utilization is above 100%, the line must be set to 200,000,000 USDS.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation - Long Term Calculation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - stUSDS Bounded External Access Module - Parameter Adjustments - Update Methodology - Calculations For Update - Line Calculation - Long Term Calculation Core

In the long term, the line must be gradually increased when Utilization is above 85% according to the following formula:

line = 1.14 * current SKY borrowing
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper Core

In order to prevent excessive price spikes if there is high demand for leverage against SKY tokens, which could potentially lead to excessive USDS borrowing against SKY, a wrapper for the SKY OSM contract has been developed.

The wrapper enforces an upper limit on the price of SKY for the purposes of SKY-Backed Borrowing, which is set to be the minimum value of:

  1. The current price reported by PIP_SKY.
  2. The cap that has been set on the OSM wrapper contract.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter Core The subdocuments herein further describe the cap parameter and the process for its modification.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Definition SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Definition Core The cap parameter represents one of the potential inputs for the SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper. The OSM wrapper uses the minimum value of the cap or the PIP_SKY oracle price to determine the price utilized for SKY-backed borrowing.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Modification Core The Core Facilitator, in consultation with the Core Council Risk Advisor, has the ability to modify the cap parameter. The modification of said parameter is pursuant to the Operational Weekly Cycle and can be effected directly via an Executive Vote, without requiring a prior Governance Poll.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Current Value SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - SKY-Backed Borrowing - SKY-Backed Borrowing Capped OSM Wrapper - Cap Parameter - Current Value Core The current value of the cap parameter is:
  • 0.04 USDS.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures Core The documents herein define short-term logic for SKY staking rewards pending the implementation of the Sky Treasury Management Function.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term USDS Rewards For SKY Stakers SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term USDS Rewards For SKY Stakers Core Until the Treasury Management Function (TMF) is fully implemented, USDS rewards for SKY stakers will be temporarily funded by the Smart Burn Engine, subject to the parameters of the Smart Burn Engine; this interim mechanism will be discontinued once the TMF becomes fully operational.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers Core Until the Treasury Management Function (TMF) is fully implemented, SKY rewards for SKY stakers will be temporarily funded by SKY from the Protocol Treasury as specified in A.4.4 - Implementation; this interim mechanism will be discontinued once the TMF becomes fully operational.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation Core SKY rewards for SKY stakers are implemented through the Staking Rewards contract, the Vested Rewards Distribution contract, and the Vesting Stream contract, as specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract Core The Staking Rewards contract is the user facing contract that allows SKY stakers to stake their SKY to receive SKY rewards. It maintains the balance of staked SKY receiving SKY rewards for each user and the associated accumulated rewards balance.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Address Core The address of the Staking Rewards contract on the Ethereum Mainnet is 0xB44C2Fb4181D7Cb06bdFf34A46FdFe4a259B40Fc.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters Core The parameters of the Staking Rewards contract are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Owner SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Owner Core The owner of the Staking Rewards contract is the contract that has the ability to control administrative functions for the Staking Rewards contract. The value of the owner parameter is the MCD_PAUSE_PROXY.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Rewards Distribution Contract Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Rewards Distribution Contract Address Core The Rewards Distribution contract address rewardsDistribution is the address of the Rewards Distribution contract associated with the Staking Rewards contract. The value of the rewardsDistribution parameter is the address of the Rewards Distribution contract specified in A.4.4 - Rewards Distribution Contract Address.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Rewards Token SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Rewards Token Core The Rewards Token rewardsToken is the token that users receive as rewards. The value of the rewardsToken parameter is SKY, representing SKY Tokens.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Staking Token SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Staking Rewards Contract - Staking Rewards Contract Parameters - Staking Token Core The Staking Token stakingToken is the token that users stake to earn rewards. The value of the stakingToken parameter is LSSKY, representing staked SKY Tokens.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract Core The Rewards Distribution contract is the contract that handles the regular transfer of reward tokens from the Vesting Stream contract to the Staking Rewards contract for distribution to end users.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Address Core The address of the Rewards Distribution contract on the Ethereum Mainnet is 0x675671A8756dDb69F7254AFB030865388Ef699Ee.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters Core The parameters of the Rewards Distribution contract are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters - Staking Rewards Contract Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters - Staking Rewards Contract Address Core The Staking Rewards contract address stakingRewards is the address of the Staking Rewards contract associated with the Rewards Distribution contract. The value of the stakingRewards parameter is the address of the Staking Rewards contract specified in A.4.4 - Staking Rewards Contract Address.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters - Vesting Stream Contract Address SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Rewards Distribution Contract - Rewards Distribution Contract Parameters - Vesting Stream Contract Address Core The Vesting Stream contract address dssVest is the address of the Vesting Stream contract associated with the Rewards Distribution contract. The value of the dssVest parameter is the address of the Vesting Stream contract specified in A.4.4 - Vesting Stream.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract Core The Vesting Stream contract manages various vesting streams that vest SKY Tokens from the Protocol Treasury. One of these vesting streams regularly vests SKY Tokens to the Staking Rewards contract.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Core The address of the Vesting Stream contract is the address corresponding to the MCD_VEST_SKY_TREASURY key in the Chainlog.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters Core The parameters of the vesting stream managed by the Vesting Stream contract that vests SKY Tokens to the Staking Rewards contract are specified in the documents herein.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters - Vesting Total SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters - Vesting Total Core The Vesting Total vestTot is the number of rewards tokens to be vested in total over the Vesting Duration. The initial value of the vestTot parameter is 1,000,000,000 SKY.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters - Vesting Duration SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Contract Parameters - Vesting Duration Core The Vesting Duration vestTau is the total duration over which the Vesting Total number of tokens are to be vested linearly. The initial value of the vestTau parameter is 180 days.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Parameter Modification SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Implementation - Vesting Stream Contract - Vesting Stream Parameter Modification Core The parameters of the vesting stream that vests SKY Tokens to be transferred to the Staking Rewards contract may be modified by the Core Facilitator on the recommendation of the Core Council Risk Advisor through the Operational Weekly Cycle, and can be effected directly via an Executive Vote, without a prior Governance Poll. It is expected that the parameters will be reviewed and updated approximately every 90 days.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Source Of SKY Rewards SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Source Of SKY Rewards Core

Initially, the SKY Tokens in the Protocol Treasury to fund SKY rewards for SKY stakers will be funded by the 500,000,000 SKY transferred by the Sky Frontier Foundation to the Protocol Treasury.

The vestTot and vestTau parameters of the Vesting Stream contract are set such that these 500,000,000 SKY will be distributed over three (3) months. After these three (3) months, SKY rewards must be funded by SKY acquired through buybacks and the parameters of the Vesting Stream contract must be adjusted accordingly.
A.4.4 - SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Source Of SKY Rewards - Authorization Of Transfer By Sky Frontier Foundation SKY Staking Mechanism - SKY Staking - Short Term Transitionary Measures - Short Term SKY Rewards For SKY Stakers - Source Of SKY Rewards - Authorization Of Transfer By Sky Frontier Foundation Core Sky Governance hereby confirms that the transfer of the 500,000,000 SKY tokens specified in A.4.4 - Source Of SKY Rewards is consistent with the terms of the grant to the Sky Frontier Foundation. See A.2.15 - A1 - Ecosystem Entity Grants.
4.6 - A1 - Token Transfers To Sky Token Transfers To Sky Section This Section defines standard procedures for sending tokens to Sky.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists Core The documents herein define processes for sending tokens to Sky. These include the DssBlow2 contract for adding Dai and USDS to the Surplus Buffer, and the Pause Proxy contract for non-stablecoins.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol Core The documents herein define the instructions for transferring stablecoins to Sky.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract Core Transfers of Dai or USDS that are not required to pay down vault debt should result in an increase to the Sky Protocol Surplus Buffer (see A.3.6 - A1 - Surplus Buffer And Smart Burn Engine - Surplus Buffer). This process is handled via the DssBlow2 contract, as described in the subdocuments.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract - DssBlow2 Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract - DssBlow2 Core Dai or USDS tokens can be transferred to the DssBlow2 contract, MCD_BLOW2, at 0x81EFc7Dd25241acd8E5620F177E42F4857A02B79. Calling the blow function on this contract will cause any Dai or USDS tokens held by it to be added to the Surplus Buffer. During this process, the ERC-20 tokens are burned and the tokens are instead reflected as an internal balance in the MCD_VAT contract.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract - DssBlow2 - Unrecoverability Of Non-Dai Or USDS Tokens Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Dai Or USDS To DssBlow2 Contract - DssBlow2 - Unrecoverability Of Non-Dai Or USDS Tokens Core Only Dai or USDS are supported by DssBlow2. Any other tokens sent to DssBlow2 are not recoverable by Sky. Senders bear full responsibility; such transfers are not considered a valid receipt of funds owed.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Transfer Of Other Stablecoins Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Transfer Of Other Stablecoins Core Stablecoins other than Dai or USDS cannot be added to the Surplus Buffer via DssBlow2. They should either (1) be converted to Dai or USDS and sent to DssBlow2 or (2) be sent to the Pause Proxy contract without conversion. Receipt of Dai or USDS is Sky's preferred method of receiving stablecoins.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol Core The documents herein define the instructions for transferring non-stablecoins to Sky.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Non-Stablecoins To Pause Proxy Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Non-Stablecoins To Pause Proxy Core Transfers of non-stablecoins to Sky should be sent to the Pause Proxy contract.
4.6 - Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Non-Stablecoins To Pause Proxy - Pause Proxy Token Transfers To Sky - Process for Returning Tokens To Sky When No Specific Process Exists - Transfer Of Non-Stablecoins To Sky Protocol - Send Non-Stablecoins To Pause Proxy - Pause Proxy Core The Pause Proxy Contract, MCD_PAUSE_PROXY, at 0xbe8e3e3618f7474f8cb1d074a26affef007e98fb, is under the direct control of Sky Governance. Sky Governance may take actions through Executive Votes to interact with the tokens held by the Pause Proxy, including selling these tokens.
A.5.2 - A1 - Brand Identity Brand Identity Section This Section defines the management and use of Sky's brand identity.
A.5.2 - Brand Identity - Website And Domain Brand Identity - Website And Domain Core The IP rights of the Sky website must be transferred to an entity similar to the Dai Foundation.
A.5.2 - Brand Identity - Dai Brand Identity - Dai Core Dai must remain as a valid token and product, with no actively maintained brand presence beyond community assets, educational material and its token name.
A.5.4 - A1 - Accessibility Communication Channels Accessibility Communication Channels Section This Section defines rules for managing accessible communication channels to enhance public access to, and interaction with, the Sky Ecosystem. These communication channels are distinct from Sky's governance-focused communication channels.
A.5.4 - Accessibility Communication Channels - External Platforms Accessibility Communication Channels - External Platforms Core Sky must support the accessibility of the Sky Ecosystem by paying Ecosystem Actors to maintain accounts and channels on external platforms, such as Twitter and Telegram. These accounts may develop and share Accessibility content that follows the brand guidelines.
A.5.4 - Accessibility Communication Channels - Moderation Accessibility Communication Channels - Moderation Core Accessibility Communication channels are subject to the moderation policies specified in A.2.7 - Ecosystem Communication Channels - Moderation.
A.5.4 - Accessibility Communication Channels - Budget Accessibility Communication Channels - Budget Core The Accessibility communication channel budget is available to maintain the tasks described in A.5.4 - A1 - Accessibility Communication Channels and its subdocuments.
A.5.4 - Accessibility Communication Channels - Budget - Amount Accessibility Communication Channels - Budget - Amount Core The Accessibility communication channel budget is:• 0 USDS per month, implemented with DssVest. It is a monthly recurring budget.
A.5.5 - A1 - Accessibility Campaigns Accessibility Campaigns Section This Section defines infrastructure and processes pertaining to accessibility campaigns.
A.5.5 - Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward Core As a part of the brand reveal phase, the Accessibility Facilitators set up an Early Bird Reward System. The Early Bird Reward System rewarded all users signing up before the launch date of USDS and SKY with double the SKY rewards for the first month following launch. The accumulated SKY rewards were paid out as an airdrop as specified in A.5.5 - Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward - Token Distribution.
A.5.5 - Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward - Token Distribution Accessibility Campaigns - Early Bird Reward - Token Distribution Core To distribute the Early Bird Reward the following actions have been or will be taken: • 27,222,832.8 newly minted SKY, equal to 120% of the total estimated Early Bird Reward distributions, was transferred to the multisig wallet operated by the Accessibility Facilitators at the address 0x14D98650d46BF7679BBD05D4f615A1547C87Bf68 on the Ethereum Mainnet. • The remaining SKY in the 0x14D98650d46BF7679BBD05D4f615A1547C87Bf68 multisig that is not used to fund the MerkleDistributor will be burned by calling the burn function on the multisig. The estimated amount of SKY needed to fund the MerkleDistributor is 22,685,694.
A.5.8 - A1 - Location Resilience Location Resilience Section This Section defines requirements for Ecosystem Actors and Agents to implement limited filtering and full blocking of IPs.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Reduce Exposure To Locations Location Resilience - Reduce Exposure To Locations Core Ecosystem Actors in the Sky Ecosystem must actively explore and implement reasonably available options to reduce their infrastructure's exposure to locations identified in the following subdocuments as subject to either IP filtering ("limited filtering") or IP blocking ("full block").
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Consequence For Non-Compliance Location Resilience - Consequence For Non-Compliance Core All frontends operated by Ecosystem Actors on behalf of Agents are required to follow the location-filtering rules defined in A.5.8 - A1 - Location Resilience and its subdocuments. The failure to adhere to these rules will result in penalties.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs Core Limited filtering requires frontends operated by Ecosystem Actors to avoid displaying or describing features to users with IPs flagged for limited filtering.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs - Restricted Features Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs - Restricted Features Core

The features that must be restricted from being displayed or described to users flagged for Limited Filtering are:

  • Staking Rewards
  • Sky Savings Rate
  • Any other feature related to yield or rewards.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs - Flagged IPs Location Resilience - Limited Filtering Of Features & IPs - Flagged IPs Core Frontends must develop internal processes to determine their strategy for limited filtering, to ensure optimal balance of resilience and accessibility.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Full Block Location Resilience - Full Block Core Full block requires frontends operated by Ecosystem Actors to deny service of any kind to users with IPs flagged for Full Block.
A.5.8 - Location Resilience - Full Block - Flagged IPs Location Resilience - Full Block - Flagged IPs Core User IPs flagged for Full Block are:• Cuba• Iran• Syria• North Korea• Crimea and Sevastopol• Donetsk People's Republic• Luhansk People's Republic of Ukraine• Kherson Oblast• Zaporizhzhia Oblast
A.5.9 - A1 - Short-Term Transitionary Measures Short-Term Transitionary Measures Section The logic defined in this section are short term transitionary measures related to the Accessibility Scope before budgets or measures can be transitioned to Sky Entities, Agents, or other Ecosystem Actors.
A.5.9 - Sky Ecosystem Liquidity Bootstrapping Sky Ecosystem Liquidity Bootstrapping Core The Accessibility Facilitators must work with advisors and Ecosystem Actors to implement a liquidity bootstrapping program using up to 20 million USDS and 320 million SKY. These assets can be used for liquidity programs, or for liquidity infrastructure integration costs. Anything leftover from usage in liquidity programs must be returned to Sky control at the end of the bootstrapping program.
The funds can be paid into multisig accounts for future use via executive votes at will by the Accessibility Facilitators.
A.6.1 - A1 - List Of Prime Agent Artifacts List Of Prime Agent Artifacts Section The documents herein each set out the unique Artifact for a particular Prime Agent. Prime Agent Artifacts contain all rules, processes, parameters, and information relevant to the Prime Agent. Prime Agent Artifacts are collections of documents that define each Agent's strategic vision and day-to-day operational logic.
A.6.1 - A2 - List Of Executor Agent Artifacts List Of Executor Agent Artifacts Section The documents herein each set out the Artifacts for Executor Agents. Executor Agent Artifacts contain all rules, processes, parameters, and information relevant to the Agent.

Type Specifications

Doc No (or Temp Name) Name Type Type Overview Components Type Category Doc Identifier Rules Additional Logic
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Type Specification Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Type Specification Type Type Specification The Type Specification Type is used for Type Specification Documents that specify the characteristics of each of the different Document Types. It ensures that all Type Specifications contain all necessary information to make it easy to reason about whether a document follows the requirements for its type. "Type Name": The Type Name Component must contain the name of the Document Type"Type Overview": The Type Overview Component must contain high level information as human-readable text about the type, such as what it is used for and why it is necessary."Type Components": If the Type has Components, they must be specified in this Component as a nested object."Type Category": This Component must specify whether the Type is an Immutable Document, a Primary Document, a Supporting Document, or a Translation Document."Document Identifier Rules": This Component must specify as human-readable text rules related to the Document Identifier for Atlas Documents of this Type, and their locations in the Document Trees."Additional Logic": This Component can contain additional logic that applies to all Documents of the Type. Primary Document Type Specification Documents must follow the Document Identifier rules for Primary Documents. The rules specified in Type Specification Documents must be followed for all Atlas Documents.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Atlas Preamble Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Atlas Preamble Type Type Specification The Atlas Preamble Type is used for the Atlas Preamble Document Tree which starts at the 0th position of the first layer of the Atlas. The Atlas Preamble details the Spirit of the Atlas in human-readable language, and specifies important definitions for understanding the Spirit of the Atlas, that must be used as context when interpreting all other parts of the Atlas. "Content": The content Component is very flexible and defines in broad human-readable language the Spirit of the Atlas. Immutable Document Atlas Preamble Documents are located at A.0 or as nested Documents one layer below A.0. Atlas Preamble Documents are immutable, foundational parts of the Atlas and their content must be considered when interpreting all other Atlas Documents.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Scope Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Scope Type Type Specification The Scope Type is used for the six nonzero Immutable Documents of the first layer of the Atlas that directly describe focus areas, principles, rules and processes of Sky Governance. Scope Documents define the broad boundaries, requirements and objectives of each of the six Atlas Scopes, so that they together can fully cover all activities that are needed for Sky to function while maintaining its resilient equilibrium. "Content": The content Component is very flexible and defines in broad human-readable language core principles, rules and processes. Immutable Document Scope Documents have the Document Identifiers from A.1 to A.6. Scope Documents are immutable, foundational parts of the Atlas and their content must be considered when interpreting all principles, rules and processes of Atlas Documents nested below them
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Article Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Article Type Type Specification The Article Type is used for the second layer documents nested below the six Scope documents of the Atlas. They directly describe individual focus areas that together fully cover everything needed for the purpose of the Scope to be fulfilled. "Content": The content Component is very flexible and defines in broad human-readable language core principles, rules and processes of the specific focus area of the Scope that the Article covers, and provides the starting point, requirements, boundaries, and in some cases immutable specifications, needed to develop the Adaptive Documents that are nested at lower layers of the Document Trees to maximally fulfill their practical purpose without violating the Spirit of the Atlas. Immutable Document Article Documents have Document Identifiers one layer below the Scope Documents. Article Documents are immutable, foundational parts of the Atlas and their content must be considered when interpreting all principles, rules and processes of Atlas Documents nested below them.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Section Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Section Type Type Specification The Section Type is used for the third layer of Immutable Documents nested under the Articles of each Scope in the Atlas. Section Documents provide additional structure and specification to the principles, rules and processes within the focus area of the Article. The Section Type acts as a foundation and boundary against misalignment of the Adaptive Documents that are nested below it. Generally, Section Documents should be "atomized", or restricted to specifying only a single discrete unit of logic. "Content": The content Component is very flexible and provides in-depth human-readable language to elaborate on the specific principles, rules, and processes that operationalize the Section's parent Article. Immutable Document Section Documents have Document Identifiers one layer below the Article Documents. Section Documents are immutable parts of the Atlas and their content must be considered when interpreting all principles, rules and processes of Adaptive Documents nested below them.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Core Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Core Type Type Specification The Core Type is the basic building block of the Primary Documents. Core Documents flexibly specify the core principles, rules and processes required to fulfil the specifications made by the Immutable Documents with a focus on clarity, practicality and applicability. "Content": The content Component is very flexible and defines in human-readable language core principles, rules or processes, or subcomponents thereof. Primary Document Core Documents follow the Document Identifier Rules of Primary Documents. Core Documents have Document Identifiers that are 4 layers or deeper in the Document Tree, and cannot contain 0's [zeros]. Within these constraints, Core Documents can have whatever Document Identifier that is useful for their purpose.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Supporting Root Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Supporting Root Type Type Specification The Supporting Root Type is used to mark the beginning of the Supporting Document subtree of an Immutable or Primary Document. All Immutable and Primary Documents must have a Supporting Root. Supporting Document Supporting Root Documents must always be located at the .0 position of its Target Document. The Supporting Root Documents have no function other than structurally acting as a directory for nested Supporting Documents in a standardized format. All Immutable Documents and Primary Documents must have a Supporting Root Document attached.
A.1.2 - Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Original Context Data Type Atlas Documents - Structure, Categories, And Types Of Atlas Documents - The Original Context Data Type Type Specification Original Context Data Documents explain the intention and reasoning behind the content of its Target Document, to make interpretation and extrapolation of its contents easier, and provide additional information to other forms of analysis. Original Context Data helps anchor the fundamental purpose and meaning of the target document to its original context, and should help mitigate cultural drift over time. Original Context Data can contain unstructured data used for genesis data integration of early Atlas Documents. Original Context Data Documents can form nested subtrees to organize their data if relevant. "Content": The Content Component should contain all relevant information to understand the intention and reasoning behind the wording and elements of the main Document. Supporting Document Original Context Data Documents must always be located at the .0.1 position of their Target Document, or nested in a subtree of Original Context Data Documents below the .0.1 position.
